item.title: 埃及通胀率连续第三个月略有上升
item.description: 在燃料价格大幅上涨的推动下，埃及通货膨胀率连续第三个月略有上升。【原文：Egyptian inflation slightly quickened for a third month, driven by a sharp rise in fuel prices.】

item.title: 因对特朗普的乐观情绪，比特币首次濒临 80,000 美元边缘
item.description: 受美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普对数字资产的支持以及国会中支持加密货币的议员的前景推动，比特币首次逼近 8 万美元。【原文：Bitcoin is closing in on $80,000 for the first time, boosted by President-elect Donald Trump’s embrace of digital assets and the prospect of a Congress featuring pro-crypto lawmakers.】

item.title: 香港财政司司长认为经济增长接近预测下限
item.description: 财政司司长陈茂波在每周博客中表示，香港今年的经济增长预计将接近预测区间的下限。【原文：Hong Kong’s economic growth this year is expected to be near the lower end of its forecast range, Financial Secretary Paul Chan said in his weekly blog.】

item.title: 北部风暴托拉吉加剧，菲律宾进入警戒状态
item.description: 由于 "托拉吉 "已加强为强热带风暴，预计将于周一在菲律宾北部登陆，菲律宾已进入警戒状态。【原文：The Philippines is on alert as Toraji intensified into a severe tropical storm and is expected to make landfall in the north on Monday.】

item.title: 美国通胀 "最后一英里 "更难推进
item.description: 美国 10 月份的通胀率可能最多是横向波动，这凸显出在迈向美联储目标的关键阶段，物价压力的缓解路径并不均衡。【原文：US inflation probably moved sideways at best in October, highlighting the uneven path of easing price pressures in the home stretch toward the Federal Reserve’s target.】

item.title: 即将到来的 M&A 浪潮将成为债务银行家的福音：信贷周刊
item.description: 并购银行家们希望，唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫将有助于带来比之前预期更多的新交易。债务承销商也可能获胜。【原文：Mergers and acquisitions bankers are hopeful that Donald Trump’s return to the White House will help bring even more new deals than previously anticipated. Debt underwriters could win too.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利称经济走强可能意味着降息次数减少
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，强劲的经济和更高的生产率增长可能会促使美国央行的降息幅度低于此前预期。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari said a strong economy and higher productivity growth may drive the US central bank to cut interest rates less than previously expected.】

item.title: 硅谷特朗普支持者憧憬初创企业的崛起，万斯 2028
item.description:
帕尔默-卢基（Palmer Luckey）和乔-朗斯代尔（Joe Lonsdale）等科技共和党人的目标是帮助新政府，他们可能会产生巨大的影响力。【原文：

Tech Republicans like Palmer Luckey and Joe Lonsdale aim to help the new administration, and could wield substantial influence.

】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》称，英国与英国钢铁公司所有者举行会谈以避免关闭工厂
item.description: 英国《金融时报》援引未具名的政府和行业消息来源报道称，英国商务大臣乔纳森-雷诺兹（Jonathan Reynolds）已与英国钢铁公司的中国所有者举行会谈，以避免工厂关闭。【原文：UK business secretary Jonathan Reynolds has held talks with British Steel’s Chinese owner in a bid to avoid plant closures, the Financial Times reported, citing unidentified government and industry sources.】

item.title: 巴里克落后于竞争对手，排名第二的矿商未能从金银热潮中获益
item.description: 今年以来，随着金银价格屡创新高，世界上大多数顶级金矿公司的股价都出现了大涨。但巴里克黄金公司（Barrick Gold Corp.【原文：Most of the world’s top gold miners have seen their shares surge this year as bullion prices hit repeated record highs. Not Barrick Gold Corp.】

item.title: 汽车零部件制造商 Standard Profil 聘请顾问进行债务再融资
item.description: 德国汽车零部件供应商 Standard Profil Automotive GmbH 聘请顾问，准备在更广泛的汽车行业危机中进行债务再融资。【原文：German car parts supplier Standard Profil Automotive GmbH hired advisers as it prepares to refinance its debt amid a broader automotive industry crisis.】

item.title: 交易员认为现在是 2016 年，而股市必须活在 2024 年
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在大选中获胜，给股市带来了类似于八年前他获胜后的震荡，这种似曾相识的感觉本周笼罩了华尔街。小盘股飙升，银行股跃升，S&P 500 指数创下了历史上最好的选举日和 12 个月来最强劲的一周。【原文：A sense of déjà vu overwhelmed Wall Street this week, as Donald Trump’s election win gave the stock market a jolt similar to what happened after his victory eight years ago. Small caps soared, banks leaped and the S&P 500 Index had its best Election Day in history and strongest week in 12 months.】

item.title: 伊朗因电厂引发健康问题而停电
item.description: 据半官方的伊朗学生通讯社（Iran Students' News Agency）报道，伊朗将实施计划停电，以限制使用污染性燃料的发电厂的发电量。【原文：Iran is set to enforce scheduled power cuts as it moves to limit electricity production from power plants that use polluting fuels, according to the semi-official Iranian Students’ News Agency.】

item.title: 七国集团领导人倒台，各国央行难逃厄运
item.description: 不到六个月前，七大工业化国家集团的领导人称全球经济具有出人意料的韧性。事实证明，选民对其中六位领导人的支持略逊一筹。【原文：Less than six months ago, leaders of the Group of Seven industrialized nations described the global economy as unexpectedly resilient. Voter support for six of those leaders has proven somewhat less so.】

item.title: 图斯克表示希望在 2025 年冻结波兰能源价格
item.description: 波兰总理唐纳德-图斯克（Donald Tusk）表示，波兰政府计划明年继续冻结能源价格，并批评欧盟限制碳排放的计划在经济上是有害的。【原文：Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said his government plans to keep energy prices frozen next year and criticized European Union plans to limit carbon emissions as economically harmful.】

item.title: 绘制全球经济地图：特朗普获胜在全球引起反响
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普决定性地赢得了美国总统大选，世界各国领导人已经开始为他的下届政府将如何塑造全球经济做准备。【原文：Donald Trump’s decisive win of the US presidential election has world leaders already preparing for how his next administration will shape the global economy.】

item.title: 印度电力财务公司拒绝向沙普尔吉偿还 24 亿美元债务
item.description: 印度国营电力金融公司（Power Finance Corporation Ltd）的一位高级官员表示，该公司已决定不向 Shapoorji Pallonji 集团提供贷款，从而使这家基础设施企业集团为价值约 2,000 亿卢比（约合 24 亿美元）的债务进行再融资的计划受到质疑。【原文：India’s state-run Power Finance Corporation Ltd has decided against extending a loan to Shapoorji Pallonji Group, a top official said, throwing into doubt the infrastructure conglomerate’s plans to refinance debt worth around 200 billion rupees ($2.4 billion).】

item.title: 阿达尼公司付款后，孟加拉国仍面临电力供应减少的问题
item.description: 孟加拉国面临着持续的电力短缺，增加了停电的风险，即使在向印度的一家发电厂支付了部分款项之后，该发电厂还是因为未支付账单而削减了电力供应。【原文：Bangladesh faces a continuing shortage of electricity, increasing the risk of blackouts, even after making a partial payment to a power plant in India that slashed supply because of unpaid bills.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：俄罗斯考虑合并最大石油公司的计划
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》报道，俄罗斯官员和企业高管就将该国最大的石油公司合并为单一生产商举行了会谈。【原文：Russian officials and business executives have held talks about merging the country’s biggest oil companies into a single producer, the Wall Street Journal reported.】

item.title: 据说贝恩接近达成收购 Blackstone 旗下 Avery Lodge 的交易
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士透露，贝恩资本（Bain Capital）在击败其他竞争对手私募股权投资公司后，即将达成收购黑石集团（Blackstone Inc.【原文：Bain Capital is nearing a deal to acquire Blackstone Inc.’s Singapore worker dormitory firm Avery Lodge after outbidding other rival private equity firms, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 通货紧缩压力不减，中国物价保持零增长
item.description: 10 月份，中国的消费通胀率微弱，而出厂价格则继续下降，这表明政府最新一轮的刺激措施远不足以使经济摆脱通货紧缩的控制。【原文：China’s consumer inflation was anemic in October while factory-gate prices continued falling, suggesting the government’s latest round of stimulus is far from sufficient to free the economy from the grip of deflation.】

item.title: 亿万富翁谢伊在离婚案中获得韩国法院救济
item.description: 在亿万富翁崔泰源对下级法院要求他向分居的妻子支付 1.38 万亿韩元（约合 9.87 亿美元）和解金的裁决提出上诉后，韩国最高法院给予了他一些宽慰，决定对他的离婚案进行复审。【原文：South Korea’s top court granted billionaire Chey Tae-won some relief, deciding to review his divorce case after he appealed a lower court ruling that required him to pay a settlement of 1.38 trillion won ($987 million) to his estranged wife.】

item.title: 追逐特朗普赌注的亚洲投资者锁定贸易战赢家
item.description: 亚洲各地的投资者加大了对唐纳德-特朗普即将重返白宫可能带来的赢家的押注，推动一些热门股票大幅飙升。【原文：Investors across Asia have ramped up bets on potential winners from Donald Trump’s imminent return to the White House, fueling big jumps in some popular stocks.】

item.title: 加密货币寄希望于改组后的美国证券交易委员会在特朗普领导下重振交易
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在大选后重返白宫，而在这次大选中，加密货币行业支持的候选人以压倒性优势赢得了国会席位。【原文：With Donald Trump headed back to the White House after an election in which candidates backed by the crypto industry overwhelmingly won seats in Congress, the stage appears set for a rush of digital-asset mergers.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚月度通胀率意外转为负值，支持彼得罗加快降息步伐
item.description: 哥伦比亚的消费价格三年多来首次意外下降，出乎所有分析师的意料，也增强了总统古斯塔沃-彼得罗（Gustavo Petro）进一步降息的论据。【原文：Colombian consumer prices unexpectedly dropped for the first time in more than three years, surprising all analysts and bolstering President Gustavo Petro’s arguments for deeper interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 特朗普首日议程指南— 从税收到关税
item.description:
在胜利的鼓舞下，当选总统将于 1 月份入主白宫，准备兑现这些 MAGA 竞选承诺。【原文：

Emboldened by his triumph, the president-elect will enter the White House in January ready to make good on these MAGA campaign promises.

】

item.title: 作为一系列组织变革的一部分，Booking 计划裁员
item.description: Booking Holdings Inc.正计划进行组织变革和裁员，作为旨在释放资源和改善运营支出预算的一系列措施的一部分。【原文：Booking Holdings Inc. is planning organizational changes and job cuts as part of a raft of measures aimed at freeing up resources and improving its operating expenses budget.】

item.title: 继 S&P、惠誉上调评级后，穆迪上调克罗地亚评级
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）将克罗地亚的长期信用评级提高了两级，理由是经济增长强劲，财政政策可持续。【原文：Croatia’s long-term credit score was raised two levels by Moody’s Ratings, which cited prospects for strong economic growth and sustainable fiscal policies.】

item.title: 对冲基金看涨 WTI 的仓位创 3 月份以来最大涨幅
item.description: 在欧佩克+推迟原定的增产计划和中东紧张局势加剧之后，对冲基金将看涨西德克萨斯中质原油的仓位提高到了 3 月份以来的最高水平。【原文：Hedge funds raised their bullish position on West Texas Intermediate crude by the most since March after OPEC+ delayed a scheduled output hike and tensions rose in the Middle East.】

item.title: 芝加哥计划 12 月初再融资 15 亿美元债券
item.description: 芝加哥计划在下月初向市政债券市场融资 15 亿美元，为其债务进行再融资，以利用美联储降低利率的机会。【原文：Chicago plans to tap the muni market for $1.5 billion early next month to refinance its debt as it looks to capitalize on the Federal Reserve lowering interest rates.】
